Understate: The claim may understate the fact that lawmakers have often rejected automatic pay raises in the past.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack enough support to prove that all 41 Republican senators who blocked a raise in the minimum wage will receive a $2,800 cost-of-living adjustment.
Problematic assumption: The claim may make the problematic assumption that all Republican senators who blocked a raise in the minimum wage will receive the cost-of-living adjustment.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for why lawmakers have rejected automatic pay raises in the past, which the claim does not consider.
